formattedAddress: 70 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006, USA
adrFormatAddress: 70 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006, USA

originalText.text: The parking location is great who wants to visit the 9/11 tribute center. Also from this location, you can ride the train to go to another downtown street like Times Square. You will get great views of the street. But the parking rate is not understandable. We paid $49 for 6 hours of parking.

You will get great views of the street. But the parking rate is not understandable. We paid $49 for 6 hours of parking.

originalText.text:
This is near to battery park. We parked here for visiting Statue of Liberty. The charges were $44 for 12 hours.
After visiting Statue of Liberty we took subway from World trade center which is couple of blocks from the parking lot to Times Square for New York City view.

The problem with this parking is they have restrooms both the side of the parking and not are not open. They said it is for customers but we don’t have keys. Infact one side they had notice that it out of order

originalText.text: The garage itself is not bad. But the issue i faced was related to booking ahead. There was no one at the exit to buzz me out and it was hard to figure out the exit. There are two buildings connected together and staff is only on one garage. So I had troubles figuring out the way out. Follow these instructions if you had similar issue. Also the exits are not properly marked within the building.

text.text: The garage itself is not bad. But the issue i faced was related to booking ahead. There was no one at the exit to buzz me out and it was hard to figure out the exit. Also the exits are not properly marked within the building.

originalText.text:
5 Stars:  I'm a car enthusiast with a manual transmission car, and this garage is a great self-park option.  Go up to the higher levels or roof and you can get a spot with no one around you.

2 Stars: Customer service & equipment.  Gates sometimes are closed or do not open when you put your ticket in, and you have to wait for, (in my experiences), attendants who are "not pleasant."  And then you factor in the price you're paying for this "service"...

= 4 Stars:  I'll deal with the shortcomings to park my own car where I want.  And let's be honest, this is NYC.  If you find a place with nice attendants that drive stick well and have safe spots for your car, chances are it's in another multiverse.

(Edited: 11/14/23.  Several more uses with no issues and added a photo of a car nicer than mine.)

originalText.text:
I love all these tourons who are like “I couldn’t find my car and no one helped me” as if they keep track of your car out of hundreds. Also, 2h5m is more than 2h, so get your act together or pay the posted rate. Every other garage would do this to you as well.

I’ve been a monthly parker here for nearly 2 years and here’s the lowdown.

The good: Large garage and self park, which is unheard of in the city. At least from a monthly perspective, the rate is great and I like not having to give an hour notice to get my car.

The neutral: The lanes are tight but so is everything in NYC, so either know your car well or find a valet garage. Large SUVs and trucks with amateur drivers should probably avoid because you’re keeping me from getting up the ramp.

The bad: The spaces are annoyingly small, so finding a spot where you’re not guaranteed to be door dinged is difficult.

Overall, self park makes this place a gem and makes the rest worth it. I used to park in a valet and there was clear evidence they took naps in my car.
